title: 23 tailgating essentials every football fan needs for game day success 🏈
description: Football is back! We've compiled a list to help champion your tailgate this season:
content:
• Football season is back, and whether it's high school, college, or NFL, tailgating is a must.
• From canopies and grills to team gear and entertainment, proper planning is key for a successful tailgate.
• Food, drinks, and seating are essential, but don't forget the smaller items like utensils and charging options.
• Keep the party going with games, music, and ways to beat the heat.
• Team spirit is encouraged, so rep your favorite colors and logos.

It is football season. High school football is kicking off, or close to it. It's Week 0 of college football. NFL preseason has been underway for some time, and the regular season inches closer! Everyone's favorite time of year is back and if you're planning to tailgate at any level this season, you need to be prepared.

Tailgating doesn't necessarily require a pickup truck, although one does come in handy. But, you can use whatever car you have that will carry all of your necessities. The best idea is to team up with a small group for the best vibes! From tables to grills and even fun things to keep you busy, there's plenty you can contribute. Don't show up to the tailgate empty-handed!

The USA TODAY Shopping team has compiled a helpful list of all your tailgating needs this season. You can check out the following categories:

Pack the basics: Canopy, table, chairs and more

Stay covered in any weather with a rapid shelter canopy

A foldable, metal-top table for all your tailgating needs

Rest up, give yourself somewhere comfy to sit

Make packing up and moving easier with a utility cart

You're going to need your phone, keep it charged

What is a tailgate without food and drinks?

Stock up on all of your tailgate needs, in bulk

Whether you're grabbing meat for BBQ, burgers or even tacos, you can get all your needs in bulk. Here are some top items, that you might forget to pick up:
• Meat, from steaks and chicken to burgers
• Sides, like bags of chips or a fruit platter
• Drinks, juices, sodas, water and even alcohol (for those of you who are over the age of 21, of course)

All that food, you're gonna need somewhere to cook it

From meat to drinks, keep it all cold in a custom team YETI cooler
• Not interested in a team-specific cooler? Grab one from the kitchen experts at Ninja and keep 50 quarts cold.

Keep your drink close & your rivalry closer with a Stanley Carry-all

The best part about tailgating is the vibe - keep them going!

Challenge your rivals in the parking lot to cornhole

Toss the ol' pigskin around before you watch the pros do it

Keep up with all the games without emptying your wallet

Rep your team with the latest gear

Go big or go home in Whataburger's latest collab with Academy

Make sure your shoes match with official collections from Nike, Adidas and HeyDude

Be the tailgate champion! Pro-tips for the best experience

Keep the mosquitoes away

Care about your team and the environment with a collapsible trash bin

Keep everything charged for the entire party with a GRECELL portable generator
summary: The USA TODAY Shopping team has compiled a list of essential tailgating essentials for football fans. From canopies and grills to team gear and entertainment, proper planning is crucial for a successful tailgate. Food, drinks, and seating are essential, but don't forget smaller items like utensils and charging options. Team spirit is encouraged, so rep your team's colors and logos. The USA TODAY shopping team has highlighted the best ways to keep the party going, including games, music, and ways to beat the heat. The list also includes a rapid shelter canopy, a portable table, and a custom team YETI cooler.
shortSummary: Football season is underway, and proper planning is essential for successful tailgating, including adequate food, drinks, and charging options for multiple games.

The Dallas Cowboys will host the Kansas City Chiefs on Thanksgiving, how to buy tickets
You can already purchase 2025 NFL tickets for Thanksgiving Day games.
The 2025 NFL schedule was released in its entirety on Wednesday, May 14 at 8 p.m. ET, but the league revealed a few appetizer games ahead of Wednesday evening's main course that fans are still talking about.
First, it was announced that the Eagles will host the Cowboys to kick off the regular season on Thursday, Sept. 4
Next, we learned about a few holiday games including the Chiefs hosting the Broncos on Christmas Day.
Those were both important games that will receive a lot of hype, but very few days during the NFL's regular season are as important as Thanksgiving Day.
The Dallas Cowboys have hosted an NFL Thanksgiving game every year since 1966, but 2025's game could be one of the biggest yet as Patrick Mahomes and the Kansas City Chiefs will travel to AT&T Stadium for the 4:30 p.m. ET late afternoon game.
Here is everything you need to know in order to buy tickets to the Cowboys vs. Chiefs NFL game on Thanksgiving.
Shop Cowboys vs. Chiefs Thanksgiving tickets

The Savannah Bananas are on tour! Here's how to buy Bananas tickets
Love going to baseball games, but think it can be a bit boring at times? Well do we have exciting news for you!
Baseball fans across the United States will be able to enjoy the thrilling and unconventional play of Banana Ball.
The famed Savannah Bananas baseball team is currently on its Banana Ball World Tour, which consists of 48 games across 25 states. The season began in February and runs until late September.
The Bananas are in essence the Harlem Globetrotters of baseball, where entertainment, fun and crazy antics are on full display.
Shop 2025 Savannah Bananas tickets
Fans attending a Bananas game should expect a wide variety of antics, like team owner, Jesse Cole, wearing a yellow tuxedo, a dancing umpire, players wearing kilts and more. Here are just some of the rules of Banana Ball:
- Fans can make outs: if a spectator in the crowd catches a foul ball, it's an out
- Batters can steal first base: If a pitcher throws a wild pitch, a batter can take first
- No walks: On ball four, the batter runs to first and can advance to as many bases as possible while the catcher has to throw the ball to every position player before the batter can be tagged out.
- Each inning is worth one point: whichever team wins the inning gets that point, until the final inning
- Two hour time limit: No inning can start after one hour and 50 minutes unless the game is tied.
If you're looking to snag tickets for the whole family as the weather continues to heat up, look no further. While tickets for May and June games are currently sold out, you can still grab tickets on StubHub.
Here's how you can buy tickets to see the Bananas play at a city near you.
How to buy Savannah Bananas tickets
Tickets are on sale for Savannah Bananas games, with many options available for buyers at various venues. As of publication, tickets sell for as low as $79 at certain locations.

College football is back! How to watch Week 0 games with a short-term pass from Sling
Buckle up, football fans, college football is officially back today! After months of sitting on the couch hammering away at building your favorite team into a dynasty through a video game, now you can enjoy actual live football again.
While only a handful of games will be played today, any football is worth watching. Among the highlighted games includes a ranked matchup between No. 21 Iowa State and No. 20 Kansas State in Dublin, Ireland, at 12 p.m. ET.
Like many, the confusion of what TV stations are airing certain games is frustrating and often times requires shelling out a pretty penny.
However, with Sling introducing three short-term passes, fans have the opportunity to enjoy college football in the form of a day, weekend or week-long pass to eliminate annoying monthly costs.
Here's everything you need to know about Sling's streaming passes and how to watch Week 0.
College football Week 0 schedule on Sling
- No. 22 Iowa State vs. No. 17 Kansas State at 12 p.m. ET on ESPN - Watch on Sling
- Fresno State vs. Kansas at 6:30 p.m. ET on FOX - Watch on Sling
What is a Sling Day Pass?
The Sling new Day Pass gives you instant 24-hour access. It's perfect for a big game, an awards show, or an impromptu movie night. For Week 0 specifically, fans can purchase a Sling Day Pass since all the games are played on Saturday.
How much is a Sling Day Pass?
The Sling Day Pass is $4.99, not including any add-ons.
What is a Sling Weekend Pass?
The Sling new Weekend Pass gives you weekend-long access from Monday morning through Sunday night. It's perfect for football fanatics who enjoy both NCAA and NFL or for those who are ready for a movie-filled weekend.
How much is a Sling Weekend Pass?
The Sling Weekend Pass is $9.99, not including any add-ons.
What is a Sling Week Pass?
The Sling Week Pass provides users access to live TV for seven days without a subscription or contract requirement. For those who want to give Sling a try for a week and see what it has to offer, the week pass is great to enjoy sports throughout the week/weekend and/or their favorite shows during the week.
How much is a Sling Week Pass?
The Sling Week Pass is $14.99, not including any add-ons.
What add-ons are available for a Sling Pass?
If you're adding any of the following add-ons to a Sling Day Pass, they are $1 extra. A Sling Weekend Pass add-on is $2 extra while the Sling Week Pass is $3 extra. They are perfect for watching specific content, like a college football game, or news coverage for a big event. Here's a breakdown of the add-ons available for a Sling Pass:
- Sports Extra: For the true sports fans out there check out the Sports Extra package. You'd be getting more in-depth sports channels like MLB Network, NBA TV and NHL Network. But, it also gives you more access to the ESPN-suite, with channels like ESPNU and ESPNews.
- Entertainment/Hollywood Extra: Looking for more TV and movie content? This is the add-on for you. The entertainment/Hollywood extra packages gives you access to Grit, H&I, Reelz, StartTV, HDNet Movies, Sundance TV, TCM and Bounce.
- Heartland Extra: For those who enjoy the outdoors. With the Heartland Extra, you get access to the World Fishing Network, Sportsman Channel, Outdoor Channel and more. You'll also get channels like the Great American Family channel, Cowboy Channel and Cowgirl channel.
- News Extra: Stay up-to-date with what's going on around the world with the News Extra package. On top of the channels in your basic package, you'll get News Nation, Newsmax, HLN, Science Channel and more.
Do you get Sling Orange or Sling Blue?
Sling's new passes come with Sling Orange.
What is Sling Orange?
The Sling Orange package has over 30 channels, including popular networks like ESPN, Disney Channel, CNN and HGTV. This is a popular pick for families and sports fans who want access to live game coverage and kid-friendly content. Sling Orange allows streaming on one device.

Sling introduces new Day, Weekend and Week Passes, perfect for sports fans on the go
Just in time for football season, Sling is putting you in control of how you watch TV. The live-streaming TV service is offering a new way to watch your favorite live TV shows and sports for less. You can now purchase a Sling Day Pass, Week Pass or Weekend Pass to watch your favorite content on-demand.
That means if you're trying to watch a full Saturday of sports, you can purchase a Sling Day Pass. If you're trying to catch college football's rivalry weekend, you don't have to commit to a full month, but you can buy Sling's Weekend Pass instead. And, if you're trying to watch a longer tournament, like upcoming U.S. Open, you can purchase a Sling Week Pass.
Here's everything you need to know about all the passes by Sling:
What do you get with a Sling Day, Week or Weekend pass?
Sling's new Day, Week or Weekend pass comes with Sling Orange.
What is Sling Orange?
The Sling Orange package has over 30 channels, including popular networks like ESPN, Disney Channel, CNN and HGTV. This is a popular pick for families and sports fans who want access to live game coverage and kid-friendly content. Sling Orange allows streaming on one device.
Try Sling's new Day, Weekend or Week passes
What is a Sling Day Pass?
The Sling new Day Pass gives you instant 24-hour access. It's perfect for a big game, an awards show, or an impromptu movie night. The Sling Day Pass is $4.99 to start (not including add-ons).
What is a Sling Weekend Pass?
Sling's new Weekend Pass gives you access from Friday to Sunday. This pass is ideal for a weekend of games, a movie marathon, or catching up on a show. The Sling Weekend Pass is $9.99 to start (not including add-ons), and could be used very wisely during football season.
What is a Sling Week Pass?
Sling's new Week Pass gives you seven-day access. This pass is great for a week-long tournament, watching a new series, or keeping the family entertained while away from school. The Week Pass is $14.99 to start (not including add-ons).
How much are the new passes by Sling?
- Day Pass - $4.99 for 24 hours
- Weekend Pass - $9.99 for Friday to Sunday
- Week Pass - $14.99 for seven days
Get a Day, Week or Weekend pass from Sling
What extras can I add-on to my passes by Sling?
One of the things that makes Sling so popular amongst cord-cutters is that you can customize your package and only pay for the channels that you actually watch. There are different add-ons that you can add to any Sling package, but the add-ons can also be added to any of your passes by Sling. If you're adding any of the following add-ons to a Sling Day Pass, they are $1 extra. Add-ons for the Sling Weekend Pass are $2 and add-ons for the Sling Week Pass are $3. Here's a breakdown of just some of the add-ons that Sling offers:
- Sports Extra: For the true sports fans out there check out the Sports Extra package. You'd be getting more in-depth sports channels like MLB Network, NBA TV and NHL Network. But, it also gives you more access to the ESPN-suite, with channels like ESPNU and ESPNews.
- Entertainment/Hollywood Extra: Looking for more TV and movie content? This is the add-on for you. The entertainment/Hollywood extra packages gives you access to Grit, H&I, Reelz, StartTV, HDNet Movies, Sundance TV, TCM and Bounce.
- Heartland Extra: For those who enjoy the outdoors. With the Heartland Extra, you get access to the World Fishing Network, Sportsman Channel, Outdoor Channel and more. You'll also get channels like the Great American Family channel, Cowboy Channel and Cowgirl channel.
- News Extra: Stay up-to-date with what's going on around the world with the News Extra package. On top of the channels in your basic package, you'll get News Nation, Newsmax, HLN, Science Channel and more.
What channels does Sling offer?
- Sling Orange: The Sling Orange package has over 30 channels, including popular networks like ESPN, Disney Channel, CNN and HGTV. This is a popular pick for families and sports fans who want access to live game coverage and kid-friendly content. Sling Orange allows streaming on one device.
- Sling Blue: With more than 45 channels, Sling Blue caters to a wider audience with major networks like FOX, NBC, Bravo and National Geographic. This package is perfect for those who enjoy a nice mix of news, reality television and lifestyle programming. Sling Blue allows streaming on up to three devices and the channels and local stations are subject to availability based on market .
- Sling Orange + Blue: You can combine the best of both worlds with Sling Orange and Sling Blue. It provides all 46 channels offered in both basic packages, including the 22 exclusive channels. And you never have to worry about missing a game.
Can I watch live sports on Sling?
Sling Orange and Sling Blue get you plenty of access to live sports, but for the true sports fans out there check out the Sports Extra package, including NFL Red Zone, Big Ten Network, Golf Channel, NBA TV, NHL Network, MLB Network, Tennis Channel and many more sports channels.
Try a new Day, Week or Weekend pass from Sling

Everything to know about Stanley's 30% off military discount—including how to use it
The kids are back in school, or headed back soon, and they need a water bottle to stay hydrated, a lunch box and more. The back-to-school shopping list is endless. Thanks to Stanley's military discount, you can grab their necessities in a brand they love without paying full price. Add a Stanley tumblers to keep their drinks cold all day long, and add a matching Stanley lunchbox for their favorite midday snacks.
If there's one thing Stanley does right, it's durability. So, you're also getting peace of mind that you won't need to replace their water bottle or lunchbox halfway through the school year. Even better? Stanley offers a discount for active duty, reservists, veterans and military families. It's a great excuse to add a tumbler, lunchbox or cooler to your daily routine. Whether you're shopping for a viral tumbler or a durable, extra-cold cooler for the whole unit, Stanley has a lot of great options that also double as thoughtful gifts.
Here's everything you need to know to use your military discount at Stanley:
Does Stanley offer a military discount?
Stanley is offering a one-time use military discount of 30% off. It is available to active duty, veterans, retirees, reservists, National Guard members, spouses and immediate family members who can verify their ID through ID.me.
The discount is also available to hospital employees, medical providers, nurses, first responders, students and teachers.
Are there exclusions to the Stanley military discount?
Yes, the discount cannot be combined with other offers and is not valid on prior purchases. It does not apply to Quencher Tumblers, replacement parts, accessories and sale items.
Shop Stanley for back-to-school, football season and more

Adventure Fast Flow Water Jug 2G

How to use your military discount at Stanley
You will need your military Common Access Card for this, so be sure to have it handy. Here is how to verify your military affiliation and receive your discount at Stanley:
- Create an ID.me account.
- Verify your military status by uploading a military ID Common Access card, DD-214 or other approved documents.
- Head over to the Stanley website and shop, add any products to your cart.
- Click to verify your ID.me account (including a verified status) when you checkout and your discount will be applied.
- Enjoy your discounted Stanley items!

How to buy Kansas City Chiefs vs. Denver Broncos Christmas Day NFL tickets
The official 2025 NFL schedule has been released in its entirety.
First we learned that the Super Bowl champion Philadelphia Eagles will host the Dallas Cowboys to kick off the regular season, but now we know a bit more about our future Christmas Day plans as well.
Patrick Mahomes and the Kansas City Chiefs will host the Denver Broncos on Dec. 25 in an AFC West showdown.
The Chiefs also played on Christmas Day last season, defeating the Pittsburgh Steelers 29-10.
Perhaps the NFL has a new holiday tradition, or perhaps it's hoping Taylor Swift will be in attendance, but either way tickets to the Chiefs vs. Broncos game are on sale now.
Shop Chiefs vs. Broncos Xmas Day NFL tickets
Buy Chiefs vs. Broncos Christmas Day NFL tickets
As of publication, the cheapest available Chiefs vs. Broncos NFL ticket costs $235.
The least expensive seats in the lower bowl would run you $418.
What NFL teams are playing on Christmas Day 2025?
The NFL has announced a Christmas Day triple-header for 2025 featuring some big matchups. Here's the full schedule:
- 1:00 PM ET: Dallas Cowboys at Washington Commanders
- 4:30 PM ET: Detroit Lions at Minnesota Vikings
- 8:20 PM ET: Denver Broncos at Kansas City Chiefs
How to watch the 2025 NFL season, TV channels, streaming services
The regular season begins on Thursday, Sept. 4 when the Eagles host the Cowboys. There are a number of ways to watch the NFL this season, as games are played on a variety of TV channels and streaming services. Make sure to subscribe in order to catch every second of heart-pounding NFL action this season.
- NBC - Sunday Night Football will once again be telecast on NBC, as will the opening game of the NFL season between the Philadelphia Eagles and Dallas Cowboys. You can stream these games with a Fubo FREE trial or with Peacock.
- FOX - Many NFL games will be broadcast on FOX, either nationally or in local markets. FOX is available to stream with a Fubo FREE trial, or on Sling.
- CBS - Many NFL games, mainly AFC teams, will be broadcast on CBS, either nationally or in local markets. CBS is available to live stream with a Fubo FREE trial, or with Paramount+.
- Prime Video - Amazon is back as the exclusive hosts of Thursday Night Football in 2025. Beginning in Week 2, watch Thursday Night Football only on Prime Video, and don't forget about the Black Friday game between the Philadelphia Eagles and Chicago Bears or the Christmas Day game between the Chiefs and Broncos.
- Peacock - In addition to being a streaming option for Sunday Night Football, Peacock will also carry an exclusive Week 17 NFL game near the end of the regular season.
- Paramount+ - The full CBS NFL schedule carries more than 100 games this season, all of which are available to watch on Paramount+ in your local market.
- YouTube - One of the NFL's international games will again be played in Brazil this year as the Kansas City Chiefs take on the Los Angeles Chargers on Friday, Sept. 5. The game is exclusively available for streaming on YouTube.
- Netflix - The streaming giant will exclusively have another Christmas Day game in 2025, and it could be a battle to see who ends the season as the Kings of the NFC North.

When is Labor Day 2025?
This year, Labor Day falls on Monday, September 1. In the lead up to the holiday, many brands are offering early Labor Day deals on top-selling products, including grills, griddles and grilling accessories.
What to consider when buying a new grill:
Before you purchase a new grill, be sure to take a couple things into account, like:
- Size: If you're limited on outdoor grilling space, you should consider purchasing a countertop griddle as opposed to a full-size propane gas grill.
- Portability: If you're looking to take your grilling antics on-the-go, a portable grill or griddle will be a better option for camping or tailgating season.

Philadelphia Eagles to host Dallas Cowboys in NFL opener, here's how to buy tickets
NFL division rivals will open the 2025 regular season.
It was announced on Monday that the Philadelphia Eagles will host the Dallas Cowboys in the first game of the 2025 NFL season on Thursday, Sept. 4.
The Eagles will likely raise their Super Bowl LIX banner in front of a raucous Philadelphia crowd and begin the team's title defense against the hated Cowboys.
Here is everything you need to know about the season opener including how to buy Eagles vs. Cowboys tickets.
Shop Eagles vs. Cowboys NFL opener tickets
Buy Eagles vs. Cowboys Week 1 NFL tickets
Tickets for the season opener between the Eagles and Cowboys are available now. As of publication, the cheapest available Eagles vs. Cowboys ticket costs $253.
The remainder of the Eagles schedule will be released along with the rest of the NFL on Wednesday, May 14 at 8 p.m. ET.
Eagles vs. Cowboys NFL Week 1 game information
- When: Thursday, Sept. 4
- Where: Lincoln Financial Field in Philadelphia
- TV: NBC, Peacock
- Tickets: Starting at $253
Shop Eagles vs. Cowboys 2025 Week 1 NFL tickets
How to watch the 2025 NFL season, TV channels, streaming services
The regular season begins on Thursday, Sept. 4 when the Eagles host the Cowboys. There are a number of ways to watch the NFL this season, as games are played on a variety of TV channels and streaming services. Make sure to subscribe in order to catch every second of heart-pounding NFL action this season.
- NBC - Sunday Night Football will once again be telecast on NBC, as will the opening game of the NFL season between the Philadelphia Eagles and Dallas Cowboys. You can stream these games with a Fubo FREE trial or with Peacock.
- FOX - Many NFL games will be broadcast on FOX, either nationally or in local markets. FOX is available to stream with a Fubo FREE trial, or on Sling.
- CBS - Many NFL games, mainly AFC teams, will be broadcast on CBS, either nationally or in local markets. CBS is available to live stream with a Fubo FREE trial, or with Paramount+.
- Prime Video - Amazon is back as the exclusive hosts of Thursday Night Football in 2025. Beginning in Week 2, watch Thursday Night Football only on Prime Video, and don't forget about the Black Friday game between the Philadelphia Eagles and Chicago Bears or the Christmas Day game between the Chiefs and Broncos.
- Peacock - In addition to being a streaming option for Sunday Night Football, Peacock will also carry an exclusive Week 17 NFL game near the end of the regular season.
- Paramount+ - The full CBS NFL schedule carries more than 100 games this season, all of which are available to watch on Paramount+ in your local market.
- YouTube - One of the NFL's international games will again be played in Brazil this year as the Kansas City Chiefs take on the Los Angeles Chargers on Friday, Sept. 5. The game is exclusively available for streaming on YouTube.
- Netflix - The streaming giant will exclusively have another Christmas Day game in 2025, and it could be a battle to see who ends the season as the Kings of the NFC North.

How to watch the NFL, TV channels, streaming services
The regular season begins on Thursday, Sept. 4 when the Eagles host the Cowboys. There are a number of ways to watch the NFL regular season, as games are played on a variety of TV channels and streaming services. Make sure to subscribe to all below to catch every second of NFL action this season.
- NBC - Sunday Night Football will once again be telecast on NBC, as will the opening game of the NFL season between the Philadelphia Eagles and Dallas Cowboys. You can stream these games with a Fubo FREE trial or with Peacock.
- FOX - Many NFL games will be broadcast on FOX, either nationally or in local markets. FOX is available to stream with a Fubo FREE trial, or on Sling.
- CBS - Many NFL games, mainly AFC teams, will be broadcast on CBS, either nationally or in local markets. CBS is available to live stream with a Fubo FREE trial, or with Paramount+.
- Prime Video - Amazon is back as the exclusive hosts of Thursday Night Football in 2025. Beginning in Week 2, watch Thursday Night Football only on Prime Video, and don't forget about the Black Friday game between the Philadelphia Eagles and Chicago Bears or the Christmas Day game between the Chiefs and Broncos.
- Peacock - In addition to being a streaming option for Sunday Night Football, Peacock will also carry an exclusive Week 17 NFL game near the end of the regular season.
- Paramount+ - The full CBS NFL schedule carries more than 100 games this season, all of which are available to watch on Paramount+ in your local market.
- YouTube - One of the NFL's international games will again be played in Brazil this year as the Kansas City Chiefs take on the Los Angeles Chargers on Friday, Sept. 5. The game is exclusively available for streaming on YouTube.
- Netflix - The streaming giant will exclusively have two Christmas Day games again in 2025, and both appear to be divisional battles that could decide the fate of the NFC North and NFC East.

Whether you're tailgating outside Darrell K. Royal Texas Memorial Stadium or climbing the stadium steps at Neyland, these slip-ons are as comfortable as they are sporty.
It's not the first time HeyDude has released an NCAA collection, including styles in their popular Wally shoe for men and Wendy shoes for women. But, they did step up their game with the new Wendy release for the Tennessee Vols, Texas Longhorns and Alabama Crimson Tide.

What makes HeyDude sneakers different?
HeyDude shoes are known for their comfortable fit and lightweight design. The company aims to create shoes that make you feel like they're an essential part of your wardrobe.
Does HeyDude offer any discounts?
HeyDude offers a discount of 20% off all regular-price footwear to all healthcare professionals and seniors 65+, a discount of 25% off to military personnel, first responders and teachers, and a discount of 30% off to students. This discount includes shoes and accessories. You will need to verify your discount status through ID.me, then you will receive a unique discount code to shop at HeyDude.com. It does exclude collaborative styles and other specified items, and the discounts cannot be combined with other offers.

argos_summary: The article celebrates the return of football season, highlighting essential tailgating gear and planning tips from USA TODAY’s shopping team, including canopies, grills, coolers, and entertainment. It also covers ticketing details for key NFL matchups such as the Cowboys‑Chiefs Thanksgiving game and the Chiefs‑Broncos Christmas game, along with streaming options and Sling’s short‑term passes for college football Week 0. Additionally, it promotes sports‑themed product collaborations—Yeti x Fanatics drinkware, adidas college shoes, HeyDude collegiate sneakers, and an Academy Sports + Whataburger gear line—offering fans ways to gear up for game day. The piece serves as a comprehensive guide for fans to prepare, purchase tickets, and enjoy the season’s festivities.
